briefdescription.para: Emit an info log if info logging is enabled.
Emit a debug log if debug logging is enabled.
Emit a warning log if info logging is enabled.
Emit an error log if error logging is enabled.
Read IE_LOG_LEVEL once and cache it for the process lifetime.

detaileddescription.para: This module uses a local log level cache to avoid repeated getenv calls. The log level defaults to 2 (info) to aid diagnostics during development.

briefdescription.para: Return non-zero if the requested logging level is enabled.
Log an errno-based failure with contextual path information.
Skip ASCII whitespace characters in a string.

simplesect.para: Pointer advanced past whitespace, or NULL if p is NULL.

briefdescription.para: Copy a C-string into a bounded buffer and always NUL-terminate.
Return a pointer to the last '/' in a path, or NULL if none.

memberdef.argsstring: (char *out, size_t outsz, const char *dir, const char *file)
memberdef.name: join_path

briefdescription.para: Join directory and filename into an output buffer (NUL-terminated).

detaileddescription.para:
This function performs a bounded concatenation:
If dir ends with '/', it is not duplicated.
If dir is empty, file is copied verbatim.

briefdescription.para: Read an entire file into a newly allocated NUL-terminated buffer.

listitem.para: Strips a UTF-8 BOM if present.

parameterdescription.para: Output pointer to malloc'd buffer (caller frees).

briefdescription.para: Scan a relaxed JSON blob for an integer value at a given key.

detaileddescription.para:
This is a best-effort scan that:
searches for "key" occurrences,
expects a ':' after the key,
parses a base-10 integer with strtol().
It does not validate full JSON structure.

simplesect.para: 1 if found, 0 if not found, negative on invalid args.

memberdef.argsstring: (char *dst, size_t dstsz, const char *src, size_t srclen)
memberdef.name: json_unescape_into

briefdescription.para: Unescape a JSON string into a destination buffer (best-effort).

detaileddescription.para:
Supported escapes:
" \ \/
\r \t
Unknown escapes are handled by dropping the backslash and copying the escaped character verbatim.

simplesect.para: Number of bytes written (excluding NUL terminator).

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *json, const char *key, char *dst, size_t dstsz)
memberdef.name: scan_json_key_string

briefdescription.para: Scan a relaxed JSON blob for a string value at a given key.

detaileddescription.para: Finds "key": "value" and copies a minimally unescaped value into dst. This scan does not validate full JSON structure; it is tolerant to extra whitespace and unrelated fields.

simplesect.para: 1 if found, 0 if not found, negative on invalid args.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *json, const char *key, const char **out_begin, const char **out_end)
memberdef.name: scan_json_object_range

briefdescription.para: Locate the interior byte range of an object value "{ ... }" for a key.

detaileddescription.para: This helper attempts to locate "key": { ... } and returns a range that covers the interior of the braces. Strings are respected when tracking brace depth to avoid premature termination.

parameterdescription.para: Output end pointer (points to closing brace).

simplesect.para: 1 if found, 0 if not found/malformed, negative on invalid args.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *begin, const char *end, const char *key, char *dst, size_t dstsz)
memberdef.name: scan_json_key_string_in_range

briefdescription.para: Scan for a string key within a bounded [begin,end] range.

detaileddescription.para: This is used for nested objects discovered by scan_json_object_range().

parameterdescription.para: Range end (inclusive, points to closing brace or last valid byte).

simplesect.para: 1 if found, 0 if not found, negative on invalid args.

briefdescription.para: Try multiple schema variants to locate the weights binary path.

detaileddescription.para:
The loader tolerates different JSON shapes by checking:
"bin"
"weights_bin"
"weightsBin"
"weights_path"
"weightsPath"
"weights": { "bin": ... }
"iebin": { "bin": ... }

parameterdescription.para: Output buffer for the path value.

simplesect.para: 1 if found, 0 if not found, negative on invalid args.

memberdef.argsstring: (int fd, void *buf, size_t count, off_t offset)
memberdef.name: ie_pread

briefdescription.para: Portable pread wrapper with fallback.

detaileddescription.para: When pread(2) is unavailable, falls back to lseek+read and restores the file offset. This is slower but sufficient for small diagnostic reads.

briefdescription.para: ASCII-only case-insensitive equality.
Parse environment flag-like strings into a boolean.

detaileddescription.para: Accepts: 0/1, false/true, no/yes, off/on (ASCII case-insensitive). Unknown values default to enabled (1).

briefdescription.para: Check if a path exists and is readable.
Create a best-effort model.dedup.json manifest for runtime dedup.

detaileddescription.para: The runtime dedup loader expects a file named "model.dedup.json" in the model directory. Some pipelines emit the same JSON under different names.

This helper attempts to:
locate an existing manifest under a set of common alternative filenames (or a user-provided IE_DEDUP_MANIFEST override), then
create "model.dedup.json" as a symlink pointing at that file, and
fall back to copying the file if symlinks are unavailable.
Failures are not fatal unless the caller is operating under strict mode.

simplesect.para: 1 if model.dedup.json ends up readable, else 0.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *dir, char *out_rel, size_t out_rel_n, char *out_abs, size_t out_abs_n)
memberdef.name: find_dedup_manifest_source_

briefdescription.para: Touch a file by doing small reads near start/end.

detaileddescription.para: This is intended as a fast readability check and optional OS cache warming. It is deliberately minimal and does not attempt to validate file contents.

briefdescription.para: Open and parse an IEBIN v1 model description.

detaileddescription.para:
This function:
reads model.ie.json,
parses minimal metadata (version, dtype),
resolves the path to model.ie.bin using overrides and schema variants,
validates the weights binary size via stat(2),
optionally opens dedup artifacts when enabled.
In all error cases, the output structure is left in a safe-to-close state.

parameterdescription.para: Optional override for the binary path (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: IE_IO_OK on success; negative ie_io_status_t on failure.

briefdescription.para: Touch the weights binary to verify readability and warm OS caches.

detaileddescription.para: This performs small reads near the start and end of the binary. When dedup is enabled, also checks auxiliary dedup files.

simplesect.para: IE_IO_OK on success; negative ie_io_status_t on failure.

briefdescription.para: Close an opened weights descriptor and release optional dedup handles.

detaileddescription.para: Close an opened weights descriptor.
This function is idempotent and safe to call on partially initialized structures. It does not unlink or delete any files; it only releases in-memory handles.

briefdescription.para: IEBIN v1 loader with relaxed JSON scanning and detailed diagnostics.

detaileddescription.para: This module implements a minimal dependency, plain-C loader for the IEBIN v1 artifact pair:

listitem.para: model.ie.bin (raw tensor bytes, typically mmap'd by higher layers)

detaileddescription.para: The loader is intentionally tolerant to extra fields and formatting changes in the JSON file. It does not use a third-party JSON parser. Instead, it performs targeted scans for a small set of required keys.

sect2.title: Logging
sect2.para: All logs in this module go to stderr via util_logging and will not interfere with stdout JSON outputs from benchmarks or CLI tools.

Logging verbosity is controlled via environment variable IE_LOG_LEVEL:
0: silent
1: errors only
2: errors + warnings + info (default)
3: errors + warnings + info + debug

The log messages are designed to make failures actionable by printing:
Which file path was attempted (json/bin/dedup artifacts)
Which schema keys were found or missing
File sizes and short-read conditions
Dedup enable/strict flags and decision outcomes
